Topic.Title: Why do entire threads just keep disappearing with no warning

Posts.EditableText: Seriously, this is getting annoying. There's been several that have just vanished off the face of the forums, and nobody is saying who did it. Several of us have said it wasn't us, but whoever is removing them hasn't posted a thing. Isn't this becoming excessive? I'm close to just taking the same direction as Zelimos, because this is pathetic.
Posts.HTML: Seriously, this is getting annoying. There's been several that have just vanished off the face of the forums, and nobody is saying who did it. Several of us have said it wasn't us, but whoever is removing them hasn't posted a thing. Isn't this becoming excessive? I'm close to just taking the same direction as Zelimos, because this is pathetic.

Posts.EditableText: Since this is a thread I created I might as well add this here. While I will still be here on the forums I've decided to completely duck out of these flame-wars and not have anything to do with them (including exercising Moderator privs). Alex, if you'd like you can remove my Mod status as I don't be doing anything with the current flame-war going on. This has turned from pathetic to worse and I'll quit while I'm ahead and not being blamed for anything. I try to be impartial, but it seems everyone is involved now and if I choose to defend anyone I'll likely be flamed myself.

Posts.EditableText:
If I may interject:

1. Humans are animals.
2. People love their pet animals (gerbils, hamsters, cats, dogs, ants, etc.)
3. Children cuddle with stuffed animals at bedtime.

It seems to be, with enough evidence, that animals are not Humans' enemies; therefore, what's the offense?  Is it that since Humans love animals and that Humans have such a tough time loving other Humans, that for two people in love to assign a pet name to one another incites emotions of jealousy within those of us Humans that don't feel loved by another Human?

-W.
